alert.note: Alert for Redwood (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 7:45AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. .An ice jam has formed on the west side of the river at the bridge and appears to extend around the river bend. The river is very close to breaching its banks. For the REDWOOD RIVER...including Redwood Falls...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Redwood River near Redwood Falls. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Low lying areas, mainly farmland, and some roads along the river begin to experience flooding; bottom of Swayback bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 630 AM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning and continue rising to 6.3 feet this evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.2 feet on 06/28/2010. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
